benchmark_details.name: FROG (Fuzzy Reasoning of Generalized Quantifiers)
benchmark_details.overview: FROG is a benchmark for evaluating fuzzy reasoning capabilities in large language models, consisting of real-world mathematical word problems that incorporate generalized quantifiers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the fuzzy reasoning abilities of large language models and examine challenges associated with fuzzy logic in mathematical reasoning problems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The questions constructed may not naturally occur and the masking-based reasoning protocol may not reflect real-world reasoning processes.

data.source: Collected from GSM8K and MathQA datasets
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on fuzzy reasoning tasks involving generalized quantifiers.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is measured as the proportion of correctly answered questions out of the total questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in reasoning tasks, while a lower accuracy indicates challenges in fuzzy reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: The best performing model, GPT-4-turbo, achieved below 50% accuracy across different settings.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using several open-sourced LLMs with various masking strategies.
